Blog.post: I love salsa. It's one of the greatest foods ever. If I met the inventor of salsa on the street, I would shake his (or her) hand. I'd probably even give them 5 bucks. If I met the inventor of plastic knives on the street... well, actually, I hope it would be a dark alley, so I could beat this person up.... but If I *had* to meet them on the street, I would make them come home with me and take all the plastic knives I have in my cupboard. I've probably used plastic knives less than 5 times my entire life. About all they're useful for is spreading cream cheese on bagels, but then they tend to be weak and flimsy... and end up breaking in your hand. I don't even know why they put those teeth on them; the only things they can cut are the same things *I* can cut just by looking sideways at them.

Last saturday was my birthday. I turned 26. I can now assign all the letters of the English alphabet to the years I've been alive. I don't know if I should be Z years old, or A years old, or whatever... I still haven't decided. Anyways, we had a barbeque party at my house on Sunday. Jeremy and I flew our kites, and Jeremy got his to lead out 1400 feet of string. I think my new hobby is going to be kite building and flying... As soon as I get my patio done. And, I don't want to do those speed kites... you know, those ones that can slice someone in two. My kite flying will be peaceful and relaxing.

The dead cannot call out for help... because they are dead. God must do the calling. God must do what cannot be done - that which is impossible. In our state, we are in an infititely deep pit, and being the finite creatures we are, we cannot call for help. God must call into being that which does not exist: life for us. Romans 4:16,17 (NASB) For this reason it is by faith, in order that it may be in accordance with grace, so that the promise will be guaranteed to all the descendants, not only to those who are of the Law, but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all,(as it is written, "A FATHER OF MANY NATIONS HAVE I MADE YOU") in the presence of Him whom he believed, even God, who gives life to the dead and calls into being that which does not exist.

Sometimes when I'm writing some code, I get stuck on a tiny little detail that takes at least 3 hours to work out. After that I usually feel pretty good about my accomplishment, especially if the solution is quite elegant... which usually it's not. CTRL-Shift-F... "TODO: FIX THIS HACK". However, after the 3 hours have gone by I'm faced with figuring out what the heck I was doing before. You know, the main task at hand. If you've seen my code, then you'll know it takes about 15 minutes to get back on track (comments are for wimps). Now, what would be really cool is timing this perfectly so that I finish the tiny little detail 15 minutes before I go home. Since I know I won't be able to get any work done during that 15 minutes, I can leave early. ... I hope Staley didn't see that comment up there.
